Author: livipup
Text: I don't think losing weight will help you more than it will hurt you at this doctor's appointment. If you lose weight your doctor is more likely to recommend impatient treatment.  I should also mention, your body does need some amount of salt. Cutting out salt entirely is possibly more unhealthy than consuming too much. If you have too much it can lead to dehydration which can cause other problems, but you can fix that by drinking more water to help your body filter out the excess. Carbs are also important. And meat is pretty good as well as long as you get good cuts of it, though you can replace meat with other sources of protein so long as you're sure to make up for the vitamins and minerals that aren't as common in plants as they are in meat. B12 is a big one to watch out for.
